PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: For PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , both CB and DCB gave the films with obvious phase separation with a root mean square ( RMS ) of 2.222 nm and 0.880 nm , respectively , which might be due to the poor miscibility of the two materials.

Let's think step by step.

```
| Property Value |
| --- |
| RMS | 2.222 nm |
| RMS | 0.880 nm |
| PC | 70 BM |
```

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. RMS (root mean square) - 2.222 nm
2. RMS (root mean square) - 0.880 nm
3. PC (polarization control) - 70 BM

Note: BM stands for "birefringence mode" and is not a numerical value, so it is not included in the table as a property value.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to "Value of material property":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| RMS | 2.222 nm |
| RMS | 0.880 nm |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and have been removed from the table:

* PC (polarization control) - 70 BM (birefringence mode)

Note: BM stands for "birefringence mode" and is not a numerical value, so it is not considered a property value.
